TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed X509VerificationFlags extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies conditions under which verification of certificates in the X509 chain should be conducted.

remarks.format:
## Remarks These flags indicate the conditions under which chain verification should occur. For example, if an application does not require certificates time values in a chain to be valid, the IgnoreNotTimeValid flag can be used.
## Examples The following example opens the current user's personal certificate store, allows the user to select a certificate, then writes certificate and certificate chain information to the console. The output depends on the certificate you select.
[!code-cpp[x509chaintest#3](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.security.crypto_107_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[x509chaintest#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.security.crypto_107_1.cs)] [!code-vb[x509chaintest#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.security.crypto_107_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509VerificationFlags AllFlags = int32(4095)

Docs.summary: All flags pertaining to verification are included.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509VerificationFlags AllowUnknownCertificateAuthority = int32(16)

Docs.summary: Ignore that the chain cannot be verified due to an unknown certificate authority (CA).
Ignore that the certificate authority revocation is unknown when determining certificate verification.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509VerificationFlags IgnoreCtlNotTimeValid = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Ignore that the certificate trust list (CTL) is not valid, for reasons such as the CTL has expired, when determining certificate verification.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509VerificationFlags IgnoreCtlSignerRevocationUnknown = int32(512)

Docs.summary: Ignore that the certificate trust list (CTL) signer revocation is unknown when determining certificate verification.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509VerificationFlags IgnoreEndRevocationUnknown = int32(256)

Docs.summary: Ignore that the end certificate (the user certificate) revocation is unknown when determining certificate verification.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509VerificationFlags IgnoreInvalidBasicConstraints = int32(8)

Docs.summary: Ignore that the basic constraints are not valid when determining certificate verification.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509VerificationFlags IgnoreInvalidName = int32(64)

Docs.summary: Ignore that the certificate has an invalid name when determining certificate verification.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509VerificationFlags IgnoreInvalidPolicy = int32(128)

Docs.summary: Ignore that the certificate has invalid policy when determining certificate verification.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509VerificationFlags IgnoreNotTimeNested = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Ignore that the CA (certificate authority) certificate and the issued certificate have validity periods that are not nested when verifying the certificate. For example, the CA cert can be valid from January 1 to December 1 and the issued certificate from January 2 to December 2, which would mean the validity periods are not nested.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509VerificationFlags IgnoreNotTimeValid = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Ignore certificates in the chain that are not valid either because they have expired or they are not yet in effect when determining certificate validity.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509VerificationFlags IgnoreRootRevocationUnknown = int32(2048)

Docs.summary: Ignore that the root revocation is unknown when determining certificate verification.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509VerificationFlags IgnoreWrongUsage = int32(32)

Docs.summary: Ignore that the certificate was not issued for the current use when determining certificate verification.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509VerificationFlags NoFlag = int32(0)

Docs.summary: No flags pertaining to verification are included.
